semantic_title: Principal Diagnosis Selection for Complications of Surgery and Medical Care
section_path: Section II > G. Complications of surgery and other medical care

content.full_text: When the admission is for treatment of a complication resulting from surgery or other medical care, the complication code is sequenced as the principal diagnosis. If the complication is classified to the T80-T88 series and the code lacks the necessary specificity in describing the complication, an additional code for the specific complication should be assigned. (Evidence: pg no: 109, L31-L33)
content.summary: Complications from surgery or medical care should be sequenced as principal diagnosis when they are the reason for admission (Evidence: pg no: 109, L31-L33)
key_concepts: Complication code as principal diagnosis when reason for admission (Evidence: pg no: 109, L31-L32)
T80-T88 series for complications of medical care (Evidence: pg no: 109, L32)
Additional codes needed when T80-T88 lacks specificity (Evidence: pg no: 109, L32-L33)

detailed_rules.rule_text: When the admission is for treatment of a complication resulting from surgery or other medical care, the complication code is sequenced as the principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 109, L31-L32)
detailed_rules.explanation: If a patient is admitted specifically to treat a complication that resulted from previous surgery or medical care, that complication becomes the principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 109, L31-L32)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If the complication is classified to the T80-T88 series and the code lacks the necessary specificity in describing the complication, an additional code for the specific complication should be assigned (Evidence: pg no: 109, L32-L33)
detailed_rules.explanation: T80-T88 codes may not provide enough detail about the specific nature of the complication, requiring additional codes for complete documentation (Evidence: pg no: 109, L32-L33)
